info.title: Cardano Wallet API
info.description:
This is the specification for the Cardano Wallet API, automatically generated
as a [Swagger](https://swagger.io/) spec from the [Servant](http://haskell-servant.readthedocs.io/en/stable/) API
of [Cardano](https://github.com/input-output-hk/cardano-sl).

Git revision: **7c08f09fbee3209715856ebec4a3a72953f5b509**
Software version: **cardano-sl:0**


## Request format (all versions)

Issuing requests against this API is conceptually not very different from any other web service out there. The API
is **versioned**, meaning that is possible to access different versions of the API by adding the _version number_
in the URL.

**For the sake of backward compatibility, we expose the legacy version of the API, available simply as
unversioned endpoints.**

This means that _omitting_ the version number would call the old version of the API. Examples:

```
/api/version
```

Compatibility between major versions is not _guaranteed_, i.e. the request & response formats might differ.

## Response format (V1 onwards)

**All GET requests of the API are paginated by default**. Whilst this can be a source of surprise, is
the best way of ensuring the performance of GET requests is not affected by the size of the data storage.

Version `V1` introduced a different way of requesting information to the API. In particular, GET requests
which returns a _collection_ (i.e. typically a JSON array of resources) lists extra parameters which can be
used to modify the shape of the response. In particular, those are:

* `page`: (Default value: **1**).
* `per_page`: (Default value: **10**)

For a more accurate description, see the section `Parameters` of each GET request, but as a brief overview
the first two control how many results and which results to access in a paginated request.

This is an example of a typical (successful) response from the API:

``` json
{
    "status": "success",
    "data": [
        {
            "amount": 29208924123228353,
            "addresses": [
                "5FCjkr138i9qs2EEjvmXF37aSLiZdwQsALPMmvVDgx8PQ31nJTh9p35ZfnDFn6hfWdyY6XuFQXY23kfUjSuwBSEd4912knFgJSSZSBCt2yo"
            ],
            "name": "My account",
            "walletId": "J7rQqaLLHBFPrgJXwpktaMB1B1kQBXAyc2uRSfRPzNVGiv6TdxBzkPNBUWysZZZdhFG9gRy3sQFfX5wfpLbi4XTFGFxTg",
            "index": 1
        },
        {
            "amount": 28089727180413548,
            "addresses": [
                "7J1MaQmKydNUyekmvgR3VNZLeLYkTNpDTKz4Z5SHfnJxDVgCN3tjixySxMNKNULKaV5XBBngc1e5BNzrePahs1Tuo7xcnKUyvkUm8HNcHuufC5q",
                "7fiTbReGezWKbx8zhrjdMekrd8kziXqofdzzGPHWKgRXd24pDM7TZSFfnarpCsHy67ZW3AgFRAfFEGuRSd1VSYP5dDyNJJLwKB29vxsFnGq9GPB8x2RittGrrjNXPpgB8b4Y3yBFbpcXeDF7FG13u5gFHrcXwU86MN2CaCpLaaynjRvnitwGnd"
            ],
            "name": "My account",
            "walletId": "J7rQqaLLHBFPrgJXwpktaMB1B1kQBXAyc2uRSfRPzNVGiv6TdxBzkPNBUWysZZZdhFG9gRy3sQFfX5wfpLbi4XTFGFxTg",
            "index": 0
        }
    ],
    "meta": {
        "pagination": {
            "page": 1,
            "perPage": 46,
            "totalPages": 1,
            "totalEntries": 2
        }
    }
}
```

## Filtering and sorting

`GET` endpoints which list collection of resources supports filters & sort operations, which are clearly marked
in the swagger docs with the `FILTER` or `SORT` labels. The query format is quite simple, and it goes this way:

### Filter operators

| Operator | Description                                                               | Example                |
|----------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------------------|
| -        | If **no operator** is passed, this is equivalent to `EQ` (see below).     | `balance=10`           |
| `EQ`     | Retrieves the resources with index _equal to the one provided.            | `balance=EQ[10]`       |
| `LT`     | Retrieves the resources with index _less than_ the one provided.          | `balance=LT[10]`       |
| `LTE`    | Retrieves the resources with index _less than equal_ the one provided.    | `balance=LTE[10]`      |
| `GT`     | Retrieves the resources with index _greater than_ the one provided.       | `balance=GT[10]`       |
| `GTE`    | Retrieves the resources with index _greater than equal_ the one provided. | `balance=GTE[10]`      |
| `RANGE`  | Retrieves the resources with index _within the inclusive range_ [k,k].    | `balance=RANGE[10,20]` |

### Sort operators

| Operator | Description                                                               | Example                |
|----------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------------------|
| `ASC`    | Sorts the resources with the given index in _ascending_ order.            | `sort_by=ASC[balance]` |
| `DES`    | Sorts the resources with the given index in _descending_ order.           | `sort_by=DES[balance]` |
| -        | If **no operator** is passed, this is equivalent to `DES` (see above).    | `sort_by=balance`      |

## Dealing with errors (V1 onwards)

In case a request cannot be served by the API, a non-2xx HTTP response will be issue, together with a
[JSend-compliant](https://labs.omniti.com/labs/jsend) JSON Object describing the error in detail together
with a numeric error code which can be used by API consumers to implement proper error handling in their
application. For example, here's a typical error which might be issued:

``` json
{
    "status": "error",
    "diagnostic": {},
    "message": "WalletNotFound"
}
```

### Existing wallet errors

Error Name | HTTP Error code | Example
-----------|-----------------|---------
`NotEnoughMoney`|403|{"status":"error","diagnostic":{"needMore":1400},"message":"NotEnoughMoney"}
`OutputIsRedeem`|403|{"status":"error","diagnostic":{"address":"b10b24203f1f0cadffcfd16277125cf7f3ad598983bef9123be80d93"},"message":"OutputIsRedeem"}
`SomeOtherError`|418|{"status":"error","diagnostic":{"foo":"foo","bar":14},"message":"SomeOtherError"}
`MigrationFailed`|422|{"status":"error","diagnostic":{"description":"migration"},"message":"MigrationFailed"}
`JSONValidationFailed`|400|{"status":"error","diagnostic":{"validationError":"Expected String, found Null."},"message":"JSONValidationFailed"}
`WalletNotFound`|404|{"status":"error","diagnostic":{},"message":"WalletNotFound"}

accountIndex.description: Target account's index to store this address in

spendingPassword.description: Optional spending password to unlock funds

groupingPolicy.description: Optional strategy to use for selecting the transaction inputs

destinations.description: One or more destinations for the payment

accountIndex.description: Corresponding account's index on the wallet

spendingPassword.description: Optional spending password to access funds

softwareInfo.description: Various pieces of information about the current software

amount.description: Amount of coin to bind, in ADA

FilePath.description:
Path to file.
 Note that it is represented as JSON-string, one may need to properly escape content. For instance:
 curl ... -X "\\"1.key"\\".
Also, when on Windows, don't forget to double-escape  backslashes, e.g.  "C:\\\\\\\\keys\\\\1.key"

used.description: True if this address has been used

changeAddress.description: True if this address stores change from a previous transaction

addresses.description: Public addresses pointing to this account

walletId.description: Id of the wallet this account belongs to

index.description: Account's index in the wallet, starting at 0

amount.description: Coins moved as part of the transaction, in ADA

inputs.description: One or more input money distributions

outputs.description: One or more ouputs money distributions

accountIndex.description: Corresponding account's index on the wallet

spendingPassword.description: Optional spending password to unlock funds

operation.description: Create a new wallet or Restore an existing one

backupPhrase.description: Backup phrase to restore the wallet

spendingPassword.description: Optional spending password to encrypt / decrypt private keys

blockchainHeight.description: If known, the current blockchain height, in number of blocks

localTimeDifference.description: Local time difference, in number of blocks

localBlockchainHeight.description: Local blockchain height, in number of blocks

get.summary: Retrieves a specific Account.

put.summary: Update an Account for the given Wallet.

post.summary: Import full information about wallet from a given file.

get.summary: Get the pending tx summaries.

post.summary: Change passphrase of given wallet.

get.summary: Returns True if given address is valid, False otherwise.
Get information about a account by its ID

post.summary: Redeem ADA.

get.summary: Current sync progress
get.description: Fetch info about local chain difficulty, network chain difficulty and connected peers.

post.summary: Create a new wallet.

get.summary: Returns the Wallet identified by the given walletId.

delete.summary: Deletes the given Wallet and all its accounts.

put.summary: Update the Wallet identified by the given walletId.

get.summary: Get local time difference in microseconds.
Get information about a wallet by its ID (address).

delete.summary: Delete given wallet with all contained accounts.

post.summary: Creates a new Account for the given Wallet.

get.summary: Retrieves the full list of Accounts.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description:
The page number to fetch for this request. The minimum is **1**.
If nothing is specified, **this value defaults to 1** and always shows the first
entries in the requested collection.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description:
The number of entries to display for each page. The minimum is **1**, whereas the maximum
is **50**. If nothing is specified, **this value defaults to 10**.

post.summary: Applies the update. Returns info about the update being applied.

get.summary: Clear the 'do not resubmit' flag from transactions that have it.
get.description: For all transactions in CPtxWontApply condition, reset them to CPtxApplying condition so that they will be passed to resubmition

get.summary: Get current version of the node.
Dump wallet state.

delete.summary: Clear wallet state and delete all the secret keys.

post.summary: Cancel all transactions in CPtxApplying condition (unconfirmed).

get.summary: Get general information about this service.

post.summary: Estimate fees for performing given transaction.
post.description: Evaluate fee which would be used for transaction created with given parameters. Note that fee may change on any operation on wallet occurs. Transaction will not be actually created.

post.summary: Export full information about wallet to a given file
post.description: Wallet may be later restored from this file with  endpoint above.

get.summary: Get information about the next update.

post.summary: Create a new payment transaction.

get.summary: Get the history of transactions.

post.summary: Creates a new or restores an existing Wallet.

get.summary: Returns all the available wallets.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description:
The page number to fetch for this request. The minimum is **1**.
If nothing is specified, **this value defaults to 1** and always shows the first
entries in the requested collection.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description:
The number of entries to display for each page. The minimum is **1**, whereas the maximum
is **50**. If nothing is specified, **this value defaults to 10**.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: A **SORT** operation on this Wallet. Allowed keys: `balance`.

post.summary: Clear wallet state and remove all secret key.

get.summary: Returns the transaction history, i.e the list of all the past transactions.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description:
The page number to fetch for this request. The minimum is **1**.
If nothing is specified, **this value defaults to 1** and always shows the first
entries in the requested collection.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description:
The number of entries to display for each page. The minimum is **1**, whereas the maximum
is **50**. If nothing is specified, **this value defaults to 10**.

get.summary: Get information about all available wallets.
Get blockchain slot duration in milliseconds.

put.summary: Updates the password for the given Wallet.

post.summary: Import user's secret key from the path to generate wallet.
Generates a new transaction from the source to one or multiple target addresses.
Redeem ADA, paper vending.
Postpone last update.

get.summary: Checks the validity of an address.

post.summary: Create a new payment transaction (can send to multiple recipients).

get.summary: Requests information about the next scheduled update.

post.summary: Request a shutdown from node.
Create a new account in given wallet.

get.summary: Get information about all available accounts.

post.summary: Apply last update.
Estimate the fees which would originate from the payment.
Send node's report on initialization time.

get.summary: Retrieves the static settings for this node.

post.summary: Creates a new Address.

get.summary: Returns all the addresses.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description:
The page number to fetch for this request. The minimum is **1**.
If nothing is specified, **this value defaults to 1** and always shows the first
entries in the requested collection.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description:
The number of entries to display for each page. The minimum is **1**, whereas the maximum
is **50**. If nothing is specified, **this value defaults to 10**.

post.summary: Create a new address in given account.
Restore existing wallet.

get.summary: Retrieves the dynamic information for this node.

post.summary: Update user profile.

get.summary: Get user profile's meta data.
Print wallet state as JSON

post.summary: Cancel specific transaction in CPtxApplying condition.
